thread.title: Arsenal News: Valentine's message for Danny Welbeck backfires horribly | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal News: Valentine's message for Danny Welbeck backfires horribly | Metro News

author: Metro Sport Reporter For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal News: Valentine's message for Danny Welbeck backfires horribly | Metro News

organizations.name: metro news metro sport reporter for metro.co.uk

text:
Metro Sport Reporter for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 14 Feb 2017 11:45 am Danny Welbeck scored a memorable winning goal against Leicester on Valentine’s day last year (Picture: Getty) 
Selecting the right gift for your lover on Valentine’s day is never straightforward, particularly if you’re the head of the Arsenal social media team and are tasked with the job of appeasing a notoriously difficult crowd to please. ‘How can Gibbs be captain?!’ Man Utd legend Roy Keane TEARS into Arsenal flops 
It’s a year to the day since Danny Welbeck capped his emotional comeback after nine months out with a serious knee injury by scoring a injury-time winner against Leicester City, a goal which looked as though it would act as a springboard to Premier League title success. Danny Welbeck may have stolen hearts, but the warm glow didn’t last particularly long for Arsenal fans (Picture: Twitter) 
Wild celebrations and a plethora of dressing room selfies followed in the aftermath of Welbeck’s winner but the glow lasted less than a week. 
The Gunners won just one of their next eight fixtures in all competitions, conceding the title to Leicester and crashing out of the FA Cup and Champions League in the process.
